title: Two- Minute Shrimp Scampi
summary: Two- Minute Shrimp Scampi requires approximately 18 minutes from start to finish. This recipe serves 1 and costs $3.16 per serving. Watching your figure? This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe has 193 calories, 30g of protein, and 7g of fat per serving. Only a few people really liked this main course. Head to the store and pick up basil, garlic, spinach leaves, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. This recipe from recipes.prevention.com has 4 fans. This recipe is typical of Mediterranean cuisine. Overall, this recipe earns a good spoonacular score of 77%. If you like this recipe, you might also like recipes such as 15 Minute Shrimp Scampi, 30-Minute Meal // Light Shrimp Scampi with Kale Pesto // Gluten & Dairy Free, and Shrimp 2 Ways: Soy Sauce-Grilled Shrimp with Spinach Salad and New-Style Scampi.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. You could try Mark West Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 13 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mark West Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description:
Crisp and clean, this wine features honeydew, stone fruit, and citrus with a subtle, clean, lingering finish.
Try pairing with good old fish and chips, summer salads, and steamed clams by the dozen...or dozens.
